channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15628] Implement an AsyncOutputStream which can work with any FileSystem implementation
item.summary: Implement an AsyncOutputStream which can work with any FileSystem implementation

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Try abstracting an AsyncOutputStream interface and introduce a new implementation that wraps an FSDataOutputStream. The performance is not a problem since we only use it in testcases.

Will be back with an initial patch.

Thanks.

Introduce a new AsyncFSOutput and a implementation which wraps an FSDataOutputStream.

Also move all AsyncFS related class to a new package called o.a.h.h.asyncfs.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Fix a issue that '%' in file name could cause creating thread pool factory fail. And also fix some checkstyle issues.

What is this Duo Zhang? Just a bunch of moving of classes? What is the motivation sir? Thanks.

Rather than in an asyncfs package, why not under wal package? (A WAL module would be kinda sweet... perhaps consumable by other projects?)

Two new classes here, AsyncFSOutput and AsyncFSOutputHelper. There are five classes which depend on each other so I move them all to a new package.

And finally these stuffs should be moved to HDFS so I think keep them in a separated package is better? I wanted to create a new sub-module at first but failed because we depend on some classes in hbase-server such as FSUtil...

Thanks.

Two new classes here, AsyncFSOutput and AsyncFSOutputHelper.

... but we also remove a bunch from the util package. What do the new classes do compared to what asyncfs classes did previous (Sorry.. I've not done extensive survey. I'm being lazy asking you...)

Ok on the move to a distinct package because they are only temporarily in hbase....

The original async output can only work with DistributedFileSystem so we can not set it as the default implementation of WAL since we have lots of UTs that only use LocalFileSystem(see the latest two comments of HBASE-15536).

The AsyncFSOutput is an interface which makes our AsyncFSWAL do not depend on the DFSOutput directly. And the AsyncFSOutputHelper does the following thing:
1. If the FileSystem passed in is DistributedFileSystem, then create the original AsyncDFSOutput
2. Otherwise, create an AsyncFSOutput that wraps an FSDataOutputStream.

Thanks.

-1 overall

moved o.a.h.h.io.asyncfs package.

Will commit shortly. Thanks stack.
Pushed to master. Thanks stack for reviewing.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Introduce an AsyncFSOutput interface which is an abstraction of the original FanOutOneBlockAsyncDFSOutput. Now you can create AsyncFSOutput on any FileSystem using the method AsyncFSOutputHelper.createOutput. The returned AsyncFSOutput will be FanOutOneBlockAsyncDFSOutput if the given FileSystem is a DistributedFileSystem.
